[[Seychelle Gabriel]]
[[Lonette McKee]] | music = Sam Retzer
Tim Boland | cinematography = [[Dave Klein (cinematographer)|Dave Klein]] | editing = Paul Millspaugh | distributor = [[Universal Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|2011|6|10}} | runtime = 106 minutes | country = United States | language = English | gross = $8,775,693{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/intl/?page=&country=00&wk=2011W24&id=_fHONEY201 |title=Honey 2 (2011) |publisher=Boxofficemojo.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-27}} }} '''''Honey 2''''' is a 2011 American dance film and a sequel to the 2003 film ''[[Honey (2003 film)|Honey]]'', directed by [[Bille Woodruff]], who directed the original film. It stars [[Kat Graham]], [[Randy Wayne]], [[Seychelle Gabriel]] and [[Lonette McKee]], reprising her role as Connie Daniels, the mother of Honey Daniels from the first film. The film was released to cinemas in United Kingdom on June 10, 2011 and on direct to DVD in the United States on February 21, 2012.{{cite web|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/461876/Honey-2/overview |title=Honey-2 - Trailer - Cast - Showtimes - NYTimes.com |publisher=Movies.nytimes.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-27}} The film was followed by a sequel, ''[[Honey 3: Dare to Dance]]'' (2016). == Plot == 17-year-old Maria Bennett ([[Kat Graham]]) returns from prison to rebuild her life with nothing but a talent for street dance and a burning ambition to prove herself. She finds refuge in the place that made her feel most alive as a kid at the rec center where Honey's exuberant classes first ignited her passion for dance. Keeping on the straight and narrow means living with Honey's mother Connie ([[Lonette McKee]]) and holding down a job just to make ends meet. She joins the HD crew to give pay back to her old crew (the 718 Crew) and ex-boyfriend Luis (Christopher Martinez) after realizing the bad influence they had on her. She convinces them to audition to compete on the television dance competition "Dance Battlezone" which means going up against the 718. Maria finds passion, romance, and hard work in the HD crew while realizing why she started dancing in the first place. == Cast == * [[Kat Graham]] (credited as Katerina Graham) as Maria Bennett * [[Randy Wayne]] as Brandon * [[Seychelle Gabriel]] as Tina * [[Lonette McKee]] as Connie Daniels * Beau "Casper" Smart as Ricky * [[Gerry Bednob]] as Mr. Kapoor * [[Tyler Nelson]] as Darnell * Christopher 'War' Martinez as Luis * Brittany Perry-Russell as Lyric * [[Melissa Molinaro]] as Carla * [[Alexis Jordan]] as Herself * [[Audrina Patridge]] as Hot Celebrity Judge * [[Mario Lopez]] as Celebrity Host * [[Laurie Ann Gibson]] as Katrina == Reception == The film received generally negative reviews with a 10% rating on [[Rotten Tomatoes]].https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/honey_2/ == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|1657283}} {{Honey}} {{Bille Woodruff}} {{Hip-hop dance}} [[Category:2010s drama films]] [[Category:American dance films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American drama films]] [[Category:Films set in New York City]] [[Category:Films shot in New York City]] [[Category:Films directed by Bille Woodruff]] [[Category:Hip hop films]] [[Category:Sequel films]] [[Category:Universal Pictures films]] {{2010s-drama-film-stub}}

revision.comment: [[Wikipedia:Bots/Requests_for_approval/PrimeBOT_28|Task 28]] - removal of deprecated parameters from [[Template:infobox company]] (+ genfixes)
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Hyper Hippo Productions Ltd. | logo = HyperHippo.png | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | area_served = | key_people = Lance Priebe (CEO & CCO) | industry = [[Video game industry]] | genre = | products = AdVenture Capitalist, Wild Warfare, Leviathans Online, etc. | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | owner = | num_employees = 20+ | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = [http://hyperhippo.ca Official Website] | footnotes = | old_name = | foundation = 2012 | founders = Lance Priebe & Pascale Audette | location_city = [[Kelowna]], [[British Columbia]] | location_country = [[Canada]] | location = | dissolved = }}'''Hyper Hippo Productions''' is a Canadian online video game and software development company. It was co-founded by [[Club Penguin]] founder Lance Priebe<ref>{{cite news|url=http://hyperhippo.ca|title=Lance Priebe - Hyper Hippo|first=|last=|coauthor=|date=|work=|publisher=|accessdate=8 January 2013}}</ref> and Pascale Audette, a former employee of [[Disney Online Studios Canada]]. Their current most popular games include ''[[Adventure Capitalist (video game)|AdVenture Capitalist]]'' and ''Wild Warfare'', among many others.
== History == Hyper Hippo was founded by Lance Priebe and Pascale Audette in late 2012. Its original purpose was to expand the size of Priebe's old studio, RocketSnail Games, which is today used as a personal studio for independent projects by Priebe. Hyper Hippo formally inherited all of RocketSnail's projects, including ''[[Mech Mice]]'' and ''Leviathans Online''.
In November 2012, [[Catalyst Game Labs]] announced a partnership with Hyper Hippo to create ''Leviathans Online''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.catalystgamelabs.com/2012/11/21/catalyst-teaming-with-hyper-hippo-productions-to-develop-leviathans-online/|title=Catalyst, Hyper Hippo Productions to develop Leviathans Online|first=|last=|coauthor=|date=|work=|publisher=|accessdate=21 November 2012}}</ref> Later, in December 2012, ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'''s [[GeekDad]] also reported about Catalyst Games and Hyper Hippo Games possibly partnering.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wired.com/geekdad/2012/12/leviathans-online/ |title=Leviathans Online GeekDad Wired.com |first= |last= |coauthor= |date= |work= |publisher= |accessdate=September 15, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121204195242/http://www.wired.com/geekdad/2012/12/leviathans-online/ |archivedate=December 4, 2012 }}</ref> In 2015, they published a revamped version of browser game ''[[Adventure Capitalist (video game)|AdVenture Capitalist]]'' for mobile.
In February 2016, [[Jagex Limited]] announced a partnership with Hyper Hippo to create ''RuneScape: Idle Adventures''<ref>http://services.runescape.com/m=news/runescape-idle-adventures--coming-spring-2016</ref> a spin-off of ''[[RuneScape]]'' described as a quick to play RPG boiled down to the basics where your character will progress in real time. On September 1, 2016 an early access beta was released through [[Steam (software)|Steam]] on PC. It was planned to also be available on tablet and mobile. It was removed from Steam, however, on May 15, 2017.
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Software companies of Canada]] [[Category:Companies based in Kelowna]] [[Category:Video game companies of Canada]]

{{Multiple issues| {{Notability|Organizations|date=February 2015}} {{Primary sources|date=February 2015}} }}
The International Fellowship of Christian Magicians was formed in 1953 by a group of individuals interested in sharing the Gospel using sleight of hand illusions. Since it’s humble California beginnings it has grown into an international organization with thousands of members from all walks of life. These members aren't only performers of Gospel magic, but also entertainers across the world, secular and gospel, that are members of the Christian faith. Notable members include entertainers like [[André Kole|Andres Kole]], [[Justin Flom]], [[Duane Laflin]], and others. [[File:Fellowship of Christian Magicians Photo.jpg|thumb|Photos from International Conference in Nashville, TN]] Many of its members are involved in ministries that not only share the Gospel and entertain through the use of illusions but also by using puppetry, ventriloquism, clowning, balloon sculpturing, drama, storytelling, chalk art, face art, juggling and other visual arts; as a result they include all these art forms at our training conventions, regional conferences and in our magazine, The Voice.
The '''International Fellowship of Christian Magicians''' has an annual [[Magic convention|convention]] that moves across the country, but is currently held in Indianapolis, Indiana. Their website is found at www.FCM.org.
== Leadership ==
The current President of the organization is Joey Evans.
*Steve Varro Former President *[[Duane Laflin]] Former President<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2008/08/jesus-magic | title=Jesus is magic | work=Mother Jones | accessdate=27 January 2015}}</ref> *Del Wilson Former President
[[File:Varro, Wilson, Laflin.JPG|thumb|right|200px|Steve Varro, Del Wilson and Duane Laflin at a magic symposium in Tyler, Texas(US).]]

{{No footnotes|date=January 2015}} {{Italic title|reason=[[:Category:Japanese words and phrases]]}} {{nihongo|'''''Kokkuri'''''|こっくり, 狐狗狸}} or {{nihongo|''Kokkuri-san''|こっくりさん}} is a Japanese game popular during the [[Meiji period]] that is also a form of [[divination]], based partially on Western [[table-turning]]. The name ''kokkuri'' is an [[onomatopoeia]] meaning "to nod up and down", and refers to the movement of the actual kokkuri mechanism. The kanji used to write the word is an [[ateji]], although its characters reflect the popular belief that the movement of the mechanism is caused by supernatural agents (''ko'' 狐, [[kitsune|foxes]]; ''ku'' 狗, [[tengu]]; ''ri'' 狸, [[tanuki]]).
The word ''kokkuri'' refers to the game, the actual physical apparatus, and the spirit(s) believed to possess the apparatus in order to communicate with humans. The physical mechanism is composed of three bamboo rods arranged to make a tripod, upon which is placed a small pot, which is covered by a cloth. Three or more people will place their hands upon the kokkuri and ask the spirits a question, which that spirit will in theory answer by moving the pot or remaining still.
Japanese folklorist [[Inoue Enryō]] wrote about the kokkuri phenomenon, denouncing it as mere superstition, yet his efforts did not succeed in depopularizing the game. Some scientific figures of the age attempted to explain the phenomena with the more scientific sounding yet ultimately equally mysterious term "human electricity".
==In popular culture== *Tamamura Tamao from the ''[[Shaman King]]'' series is a young [[Shugendō|shugenja]] who performs kokkuri in its [[Japanese_urban_legend#Kokkuri-san|modern form]]. Based on the ateji writing of the word, her partner spirits are a kitsune and a tanuki, and as a shugenja she fulfills the role of the tengu. *In the manga series ''[[Gugure! Kokkuri-san]]'', a girl named Kohina Ichimatsu plays the game by herself and summons the fox spirit Kokkuri-san who, upon seeing her unhealthy lifestyle, takes it upon himself to become her guardian and raise her properly.
==References==
*{{cite book | last = Smyers | first = Karen | title = The Fox and the Jewel: Shared and Private Meanings in Contemporary Japanese Inari Worship | publisher = University of Hawaii Press | date = 1999 | isbn = 978-0-8248-2102-9 }} *{{cite book | last = Foster | first = Michael Dylan | title = Pandemonium and Parade: Japanese Monsters and the Culture of Yōkai | publisher = University of California Press | date = 2008 | isbn = 978-0-520-25361-2 }}

{{multiple issues|{{cleanup-rewrite|date=July 2013}}{{Refimprove|date=November 2015}}}} {{Infobox video game |image = Lunar Samposuru Gakuen cover.png |developer = [[Studio Alex]], [[Game Arts]] |publisher = [[Game Arts]]
'''Sega Saturn'''
[[Entertainment Software Publishing|ESP Software]]
[[Kadokawa Shoten]] |designer = |series = ''[[Lunar (series)|Lunar]]'' |released = '''Game Gear'''{{vgrelease|JP|January 12, 1996{{cite web|publisher=[[Sega]] |url=http://sega.jp/fb/segahard/gg/soft_licensee.html |script-title=ja:[セガハード大百科] ゲームギア対応ソフトウェア（ソフトライセンシー発売） |language=Japanese |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130101202427/http://sega.jp/fb/segahard/gg/soft_licensee.html |archivedate=2013-01-01 |accessdate=2015-11-15 }}}}'''Sega Saturn'''{{vgrelease|JP|November 20, 1997}} |genre = [[Role-playing video game]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] |platforms = [[Game Gear]], [[Sega Saturn]] }} {{nihongo|'''''Lunar: Sanposuru Gakuen'''''|Lunar さんぽする学園||lit. "Lunar: Walking School"}} is a [[role-playing video game]] in the [[Lunar series]] released for the [[Sega]] [[Game Gear]] in Japan in 1996. Since then, no international versions or translations have officially been released, though an unofficial English translation was released in 2009.[http://agtp.romhack.net/project.php?id=lunar] It was developed and produced by the Japanese software company [[Game Arts]] and [[Studio Alex]], their in-house development team responsible for other Lunar titles. Even though the game was released after ''[[Lunar: The Silver Star]]'', it is set hundreds of years before it. Several creatures and places from the game also make an appearance. The game was remade two years later for the [[Sega Saturn]] as '''''Mahō Gakuen Lunar!'''''. ==Gameplay== The game has several elements common to [[role-playing video game]]s, with 2D character sprites and environments. During the game, the player will encounter monsters that are fought randomly within dungeons, and gain experience from winning battles. Magic and additional skills are unlocked through leveling up, as well as allowing the characters to grow stronger. The battles take place from a [[first person (video games)|first-person]] perspective, with menus appearing along the left edge of the screen. The character menu can be accessed at any time and allow the use of items, magic, or other gameplay settings. A player's progress is saved on one of three possible slots using the Game Gear's battery back-up. ==Plot== Walking School tells the tale of a young girl named Ellie and her best friend, Lena, as they leave their quiet lives as field workers in the town of Burg to enroll in a newly established [[Magic (paranormal)|magic]] school located on an island called Ien. There, along with several other youths, the girls find the school and the area around it completely deserted, and try to establish order by getting all the students together within the surrounding town. During their stay, they encounter several magical creatures and monsters who also call the island home, all while they continue to search for their instructors. The game itself is divided into 12 chapters, each one presented with a curtain closing and opening. ===Characters=== Playable characters: *Ellie: The main character of the story who grew up in a small town working on her father's [[farm]]. She is selected along with her best friend Lena to attend the floating magic school. Somewhat quiet and reserved, she is very loyal to her friends and has a naturally curious personality. *Lena: Ellie's best friend since childhood. Unlike Ellie, she is very talkative and often sticks up for herself when bullied about her height. She likes to wear fancy clothing and is quite self-confident. *Senia: A young Beastwoman who attends the magic school with Ellie and Lena. Though she is very strong and athletic, she can command some powerful magic as well. Almost as vocal as Lena, and the two of them became fast friends. *Wing: A mysterious and quiet boy who is a later addition to the school's roster. Naturally gifted at using magic, Wing makes a name for himself early, and is actually enrolled on a [[scholarship]]. Other characters: *Ant Kule and Rick: Three boys accepted into the magic school who make it their business to tease and otherwise make life difficult for Ellie and Lena. Eventually, they warm up to each other, but only after a lengthy exchange of insults. *Barua: Second-in-command of the Vile Tribe who has an interest in Wing. Commands a wide assortment of dark magic. *Memphis: Power-hungry leader of the Vile Tribe who worships an entity known as "D". ==Remake== [[File:Magic School Lunar! Screen01.jpg|thumb|right|A battle in ''Mahō Gakuen Lunar!'']] {{Nihongo|''Mahō Gakuen Lunar!''|魔法学園ルナ！|lit. "Magic School Lunar!"}} is an [[enhanced remake]] of ''Sanposuru Gakuen'' with updated graphics, newly added [[anime]] cutscenes, and a more complex story. It was developed by [[Studio Alex]] in association with Game Arts and published by [[Entertainment Software Publishing|ESP Software]] and [[Kadokawa Shoten]] for the [[Sega Saturn]] in 1997.{{cite web | url=http://mediaarts-db.jp/gm/syosai.php?id=392109200856&kbn=c12 | title=魔法学園ルナ |trans-title=Mahou Gakuen Lunar | publisher=[[Agency for Cultural Affairs]] | work=Media Arts Database | accessdate=August 11, 2015 | location=Japan | language=Japanese}} ''Magic School Lunar!'' was released about the same time as other ''Lunar'' remakes, ''[[Lunar: Silver Star Story Complete]]'' and ''[[Lunar 2: Eternal Blue Complete]]'', and though it was mildly successful it was never made available outside Japan. Several enhancements were made to the game that take advantage of the capabilities of modern hardware. While the first game was limited to the hardware restrictions of the [[Game Gear]], the new Saturn version boasted a larger color palette, more sophisticated music and sound effects, and the ability to handle full-motion animated sequences placed sporadically throughout the story. The use of a Saturn [[Memory Card]] could also ensure more save slots. The first-person perspective battle interface of the Game Gear version is replaced by a simplified version of the signature Lunar battle system. Character [[Sprite (computer graphics)|sprite]]s are visible on the battlefield and animations for spells and attacks have been considerably upgraded. A number of multi-character combination attacks have been added as well. ==Development== {{expand section|date=July 2013}} ==Reception== {{expand section|date=July 2013}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.lunar-net.com/ws/ LunarNet Walking School Section] * [http://www.lunar-net.com/lunarws/ Kizyr's Walking School Guide] * [http://www.lunar-net.com/ms/ LunarNET ''Magic School Lunar!'' section] {{Lunar series}} [[Category:1996 video games]] [[Category:1997 video games]] [[Category:Game Arts games]] [[Category:Japan-exclusive video games]] [[Category:Lunar (series)]] [[Category:Role-playing games introduced in 1996]] [[Category:Sega Game Gear games]] [[Category:Sega Saturn games]] [[Category:Studio Alex games]] [[Category:Video game prequels]] [[Category:Video game spin-offs]] [[Category:Video games developed in Japan]] [[Category:Video games scored by Noriyuki Iwadare]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]] [[it:Lunar: Walking School]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Master Hirannaiah | other names = Narasimha Murthy | image = | image_size = | birth_date = 15 February 1934 (aged 84 years) | death_date = | alma_mater = Sarada Vilas college, Mysuru | occupation = {{hlist|Film actor|director|comedian|writer (story|screenplay|[[lyrics]])|playback singer|theatre & drama and television artist}} | notable works = Lanchavathara | imagesize = | birth_place = Mysore, Karnataka | parents = ''Father:'' K. Hirannaiah ''(Writer & Actor), (d.1953)''{{cite web |title= Urban Legend: Master Hirannaiah, a ‘drunk’ with a punch |url= https://www.deccanchronicle.com/lifestyle/viral-and-trending/310716/urban-legend-master-hirannaiah-a-drunk-with-a-punch.html |publisher= ''deccanchronicle.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180228224129/https://www.deccanchronicle.com/lifestyle/viral-and-trending/310716/urban-legend-master-hirannaiah-a-drunk-with-a-punch.html |archivedate= 28 February 2018 |df= dmy-all }}{{cite web |title= K. Hirannaiah |url= https://chiloka.com/celebrity/k-hirannaiah |publisher= ''chiloka.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180228223748/https://chiloka.com/celebrity/k-hirannaiah |archivedate= 28 February 2018 |df= dmy-all }}
''Mother:'' Sharadamma | spouse = Shanthamma | children = Five incl. Babu Hirannaiah,{{cite web |title= A house built on family values |url= http://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/pp/2005/11/12/stories/2005111201110300.htm |publisher= ''thehindu.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180609100454/http://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/pp/2005/11/12/stories/2005111201110300.htm |archivedate= 9 June 2018 |df= dmy-all }}
and 11 grand-sons. | nationality = Indian | awards = Kannada Rajyotsava Award, Gubbi Veeranna Award etc. }} '''Hirannaiah''' or '''Hirannayya''' known by his stage name '''Master Hirannaiah''', is an Indian film actor in the [[Kannada film industry]]{{cite web |title= Master Hirannaiah |url= https://chiloka.com/celebrity/master-hirannaiah |publisher= ''chiloka.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301044343/https://chiloka.com/celebrity/master-hirannaiah |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }} and a [[Theatre of India|theatre]] artist in Karnataka, India. Some of the notable films of Master Hirannaiah as an actor include [[...Re (film)|''...Re'']] (2016), ''[[Care of Footpath 2]]'' (2015), ''[[No 73, Shanthi Nivasa|No. 73, Shanthi Nivasa]]'' (2007). ==Early life== Hirannaiah was born in [[Kingdom of Mysore|Mysore]], Karnataka on 15 February 1934.{{cite web |title= Master Hirannaiah |url= http://www.nettv4u.com/celebrity/kannada/writer/master-hirannaiah |publisher= ''nettv4u'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301164324/http://www.nettv4u.com/celebrity/kannada/writer/master-hirannaiah |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }} His father K. Hirannaiah too was an Indian film actor, director, and writer in the [[Kannada film industry]] and a [[Theatre of India|theatre]] artist in the [[Karnataka|state]]. His mother was Sharadamma. After finishing [[Education in India|primary education]] in Banumayya Middle school, Hirannaiah completed [[Secondary school|intermediate]] in Sharada Vilas,{{cite web |title= Sharada Vilas College, Mysore |url= http://www.saradavilas.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=33&Itemid=6 |publisher= ''saradavilas.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301225024/http://www.saradavilas.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=33&Itemid=6 |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }} Mysore, Karnataka. In his childhood days, he distributed newspaper ''Sadhvi''{{cite web |title= Sadvi Newspaper |url= http://ww2.etownmysore.com/sadhvi-news-paper |publisher= ''etownmysore.com''}} to [[Funding|fund]] his education, while actively participating in drama and theatre plays. After his father's death, Hirannaiah took over the management of the K.Hirannaiah Mitra Mandali,{{cite web |title= All the city was a stage for them |url= http://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/mp/2002/10/17/stories/2002101700330200.htm |publisher= ''thehindu.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070930153556/http://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/mp/2002/10/17/stories/2002101700330200.htm |archivedate= 30 September 2007 |df= dmy-all }} which was founded by his late father. Later he became actor, director and administrator of the theatre company. {{quote box|align=right|width=246px|quote="The audience is my censor board. They have paid for their ticket, if they have a problem or they disagree they can stand up and talk about it"

"My method is to have my commentary on various issues in the middle, while the beginning and end has the catchphrase which gets the attention of the audience."
|source=—Master Hirannaiah, sharing his thoughts with [[Deccan Chronicle]]{{cite web |title= Urban Legend: Master Hirannaiah, a ‘drunk’ with a punch |url= https://www.deccanchronicle.com/lifestyle/viral-and-trending/310716/urban-legend-master-hirannaiah-a-drunk-with-a-punch.html |publisher= ''deccanchronicle.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180228224129/https://www.deccanchronicle.com/lifestyle/viral-and-trending/310716/urban-legend-master-hirannaiah-a-drunk-with-a-punch.html |archivedate= 28 February 2018 |df= dmy-all }}}} ==Career== Master Hirannaiah has been part of more than 30 movies{{cite web |title= Master Hirannaiah: Filmography |url= https://chiloka.com/celebrity/master-hirannaiah#filmography |publisher= ''Chiloka.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301044343/https://chiloka.com/celebrity/master-hirannaiah#filmography |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }} in Kannada. His notable drama plays include ''Lanchavathara'', ''Double [[Thali|Thaali]]'', ''Kanya Dahana'', ''Sanyashi Samsara'', ''Chamachavathara'', ''Haasyadalli Ulta Palta'', ''Kapil Mushti'', ''Nadubidi Narayana'', ''Bhrashtachaara'', ''Anaachaara'', with ''Lanchavathara'' playing more than 11 [[1000 (number)|thousand]] times, over a span of 45 years, performing in countries like United States, Australia, Singapore, and England.{{cite web |title= Dramatists of Mysore |url= http://www.mysoresamachar.com/dramatists_mys.htm |publisher= ''mysoresamachar.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140210113844/http://www.mysoresamachar.com/dramatists_mys.htm |archivedate= 10 February 2014 |df= dmy-all }}{{cite web |title= Master Hirannayya Drama Collection I MP3 CD |url= http://www.kannadastore.com/master-hirannayya-drama-collection-mp3-p-217.html |publisher= ''Chiloka.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301044730/http://www.kannadastore.com/master-hirannayya-drama-collection-mp3-p-217.html |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }}{{cite web |title= Kannada Drama Comedy |url= http://www.kannadaaudio.com/Songs/Drama/home/ |publisher= ''kannadaaudio.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160305175319/http://www.kannadaaudio.com/Songs/Drama/home/ |archivedate= 5 March 2016 |df= dmy-all }}{{cite web |title= Crusader against Corruption: Master Hirannaiah |url= http://stories.knowyourstar.com/master-hirannaiah-interview/ |publisher= ''knowyourstar.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180301233349/http://stories.knowyourstar.com/master-hirannaiah-interview/ |archivedate= 1 March 2018 |df= dmy-all }} === Hirannaiah Award === Master Hirannaiah established the ''Hirannaiah Award'', in memories of his father who was known popularly as "''cultural comedian''"{{cite web |title= Keshava Rao, Fakirappa among 18 Nataka Academy award winners |url= http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-karnataka/Keshava-Rao-Fakirappa-among-18-Nataka-Academy-award-winners/article16526406.ece |publisher= ''thehindu.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20180609100454/http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-karnataka/Keshava-Rao-Fakirappa-among-18-Nataka-Academy-award-winners/article16526406.ece |archivedate= 9 June 2018 |df= dmy-all }} or "''cultured comedian''".{{cite web |title= K Hirannaiah – Cultured Comedian |url= https://www.sapnaonline.com/books/k-hirannaiah-cultured-comedian-4860286 |publisher= ''sapnaonline.com''}} ''Hirannaiah Awards'' are presented on behalf of Karnataka Nataka Academy, to theatre artists ''(native name: Rangamukhagalu)'' for their notable drama works. First award ceremony was held on 17 April 2010, at the [[Jaganmohan Palace|Jaganmohan Palace auditorium]] in [[Mysore]], Karnataka.{{cite web |title= Nataka academy awards to be presented on April 17 |url= http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-karnataka/Nataka-academy-awards-to-be-presented-on-April-17/article16017811.ece |publisher= ''thehindu.com'' |deadurl= no |archiveurl= A '''motion comic''' (or '''animated comic''') is a form of [[animation]] combining elements of print [[comic book]]s and [[animation]]. Individual panels are expanded into a full shot while sound effects, voice acting, and animation are added to the original artwork. Text boxes and sound effect bubbles are typically removed to feature more of the original artwork being animated. Motion comics are often released as short serials covering a story arc of a long running series or animating a single release of a graphic novel. Single release issues of a story arc are converted into ten- to twenty-minute-long episodes depending on content.
==History== The earliest examples of motion comics are found in independent creations such as ''[[Broken Saints]]'' (2001). However, the concept was fully outlined in the mid-1960s by science fiction author [[Philip K. Dick]] in his novel ''The Zap Gun'', an expansion of his [[novella]] ''[[Project Plowshare]]'', which was written in 1964 and first published as a [[Serial (literature)|serial]] in the November 1965 and January 1966 issues of ''Worlds Of Tomorrow'' magazine. In Dick's novel, weapon designers of the future are [[mediumship|mediums]], who create their new designs in trance states. The weapon designs are extracted telepathically from a motion comic book, ''The Blue Cephalopod Man from Titan'', created by mad Italian artist Oral Giacomini. Dick describes both the storyline and the animated panels of this comic book in detail. [[File:SelinaMedium.gif|thumb|Animation similar to that presented in the series [[The Marvel Super Heroes]].]]
In the mid 1960's, [[Marvel_Comics|Marvel Comics Animation]] used the technique for the television show ''[[The Marvel Super Heroes]]''. Actual artwork from the originally published comic books was augmented by voices, music, and a small amount of animation. The term "Motion comic" did not exist yet.
In 1982, the comic strip [[Jane_(comic_strip)|Jane]] was made [[Jane (TV series)|into a TV series]] by [[BBC]]. It featured brief sequences of a stylized approach to comic panels, partly done with animation, partly with actors in a drawn environment via [[chroma key]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.the-medium-is-not-enough.com/2011/02/lost_gems_jane_1982-1984.php|title=Lost Gems: Jane (1982-1984) - The Medium is Not Enough|author=|date=18 February 2011|website=the-medium-is-not-enough.com|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref>
In 2005, Lions Gate released an animated version of the ''Saw: Rebirth'' comic, one of the first examples of an animated comic created to tie into a film franchise. The first major motion comics released, which is also the first use of the term "motion comic," were released by [[Warner Bros.]], the owner of [[DC Comics]] to coincide with the film premieres of ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]'' and ''[[Watchmen (film)|Watchmen]]'', releasing an adaptation of ''[[Mad Love (comics)|Batman: Mad Love]]'' and ''[[Watchmen: Motion Comics]]'', adapting the [[Watchmen|comic book of the same name]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.watchmenmotioncomic.com/ | title=Watchmen Motion Comic | work=Watchmenmotioncomic.com | accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Peter|last=Howell|url=https://www.thestar.com/Entertainment/article/595402|title=Watchmen: The Complete Motion Comic|work=[[Toronto Star]]|date=March 3, 2009|accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121634908179464605 |last=McBride|first=Sarah|title=Web Draws on Comics|work=[[Wall Street Journal]]|date=July 18, 2008|accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref> In 2010 a motion comic called ''Inception: The Cobol Job'' was released as prequel and prologue to the movie [[Inception]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://econsultancy.com/us/blog/6277-inception-multichannel-marketing-that-works-like-a-dream|title=Inception: multichannel marketing that works like a dream|author=|date=|website=econsultancy.com|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ik0mpATaV9k|title=YouTube|author=|date=|website=www.youtube.com|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref> In 2012 a prequel motion comic of the movie [[Dredd]] was made to show the origins of the movie's main antagonist, Ma-Ma.
[[Marvel Comics]] has released motion comics using a company owned by [[Neal Adams]]. The first release was an adaptation of [[Joss Whedon]] and [[John Cassaday]]'s ''[[Astonishing X-Men]]'': "Gifted". Other adaptations include ''[[Spider-Woman (Jessica Drew)|Spider-Woman]]'': "Agent of S.W.O.R.D.", ''[[Iron Man]]'': "[[Extremis (comics)|Extremis]]", [[Black Panther (comics)|Black Panther]], ''Thor/Loki: Blood Brothers'', ''Inhumans'' and ''Astonishing X-Men'': "Dangerous".
Examples from other companies include ''[[Peanuts Motion Comics]]'', ''Zits'' Motion Comics, the ''[[Dead Space (comics)|Dead Space]]'' prequel comics and the "Lucy" element of the ABC News documentary ''[[Earth 2100]]''.<ref>{{cite web | last=Marshall |first=Rick |url=http://splashpage.mtv.com/2009/06/02/comic-creators-play-big-role-in-tonights-earth-2100-special/ |title=Comic Creators Play Big Role In Tonight’s ‘Earth 2100’ Special.| work=MTV | date=June 2, 2009 | accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref>
Another example would be a four-part motion comic based on the ''[[Uncharted]]'' video game series as a prequel called ''Eye of Indra'', released for the [[PlayStation Network]].
=== Illustrated films === A sibling format to ''motion comics'' called ''[[HALO 8 Entertainment#Illustrated films|illustrated films]]'' was developed by [[transmedia]] studio [[HALO 8 Entertainment]] with their ''[[Godkiller (series)|Godkiller]]'', which was produced at the same time as (but separately from) the ''Watchmen'' motion comic. As opposed to repurposing an existing comic book, Halo-8 created new sequential art that was designed from its inception to be transmedia art for both a comic book and an illustrated film. ''Godkiller'' creator [[Matt Pizzolo]] told [[Bloody Disgusting]] "''Godkiller'' was just a slower production than ''Watchmen'' because we had to create 200 pages of art and story from the ground up first, rather than starting with one of the greatest comic books ever made as source material. Plus we had a dozen voice performers instead of just one."<ref>THEoDEAD. "[http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/comics/589 MAY SPOTLIGHT: Halo-8 PLUS An Interview With Founder Matt Pizzolo!] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100507220720/http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/comics/589 |date=2010-05-07 }}". Bloody Disgusting.'' May 4, 2010.</ref>
Although aesthetically similar to motion comics, Pizzolo identifies ''illustrated film'' influences as including ''[[Liquid Television]]'', the [[MTV]] cartoon adaptation of ''[[The Maxx]]'', the ''[[Berserk (manga)|Berserk]]'' anime series, [[Chris Marker]]'s ''[[La jetée]]'', the motion comic ''[[Broken Saints]]'', and the experimental cinema of [[Ralph Bakshi]].<ref>Anders, Jason. "[http://fullecirclestuff.blogspot.com/2009/11/making-of-godkiller.html The Making of Godkiller]". Fulle Circle Magazine.'' November 24, 2009.</ref><ref>Thill, Scott. "[https://www.wired.com/underwire/2009/10/post-apocalyptic-godkiller/ Post-Apocalyptic Comic Godkiller Emerges as ‘Illustrated Film’]". Wired.'' October 6, 2009.</ref>
According to [[Comics Alliance]], Pizzolo stated "the difference between an illustrated film and a motion comic is kind of the difference between a movie that was shot in 3D versus a movie that was shot in 2D but got a 3D post-conversion. We're not repurposing an existing comic book here, we're building something unique from scratch."<ref>Khouri, Andy. [http://www.comicsalliance.com/2010/12/02/ben-templesmith-black-sky-illustrated-film-teaser/ "New 'Black Sky' Teaser Brings Ben Templesmith's Illustrations to Film [Video] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110111174751/http://www.comicsalliance.com/2010/12/02/ben-templesmith-black-sky-illustrated-film-teaser |date=2011-01-11 }},"] Comics Alliance (Dec. 2, 2010).</ref>
The 75-minute Godkiller feature was released theatrically in 11 cities before it was distributed on DVD and cable VOD.<ref>Moore, Debi. "[http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/37565/details-godkiller-theatrical-tour-and-vod-home-invasion Details on the Godkiller Theatrical Tour and VOD Home Invasion]". Dread Central.'' May 17, 2010.</ref><ref>THEoDEAD. "[http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/comics/616 Halo-8 Announces Theatrical Tour For 'Godkiller' Including IMAX!] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100519140610/http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/comics/616 |date=2010-05-19 }}". Dread Central.'' May 17, 2010.</ref>
Upcoming illustrated films from Halo-8 include [[Ben Templesmith]]'s original project ''[[Black Sky]]'' and an adaptation of [[Tim Seeley]]'s ''[[Hack/Slash]]''.<ref>Newsarama. "[http://www.newsarama.com/common/media/video/player.php?aid=35313 TEMPLESMITH/ PIZZOLO: Black Sky, God Killer & More @ C2E2]". Newsarama.'' April 19, 2010.</ref><ref>Marshall, Rick. "[http://splashpage.mtv.com/2010/09/10/hack-slash-illustrated-film-preview/ Hack/Slash To Get The Illustrated Film Treatment]". MTV Splash Page.'' September 10, 2010.</ref><ref>The Beat. "[http://www.comicsbeat.com/2010/12/02/nice-art-ben-templesmiths-black-sky-teaser/ Nice Art: Ben Templesmith’s BLACK SKY teaser] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101208011618/http://www.comicsbeat.com/2010/12/02/nice-art-ben-templesmiths-black-sky-teaser/ |date=2010-12-08 }}". Comics Beat.'' December 2, 2010.</ref>
==Reception== Reception to motion comics has been mixed.
[[NewTeeVee]] commented, "This first generation [of motion comics] is admittedly crude, but there is enough 'motion' in these motion comics to keep the viewer’s attention, and so far the music and voice acting have been great. Plus, the level of experimentation and sophistication will grow as more are produced."<ref>{{cite web | url=http://newteevee.com/2008/07/30/the-rise-of-motion-comics-online/ | last=Albrecht | first=Chris | title=The Rise of Motion Comics Online | publisher = NewTeeVee.com | date=July 30, 2008 | accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref>
ComicsWorthReading.com asked, {{quote|When you add camera tricks and a soundtrack to a comic, is it still a comic? Or just a poor excuse for a cartoon, done on the cheap? Are they reaching a new audience, attracted by a new format in more modern sales outlets (that come to them)? Will those hypothetical new readers eventually wind up buying traditional-format comics? Could this be just another way to try and make more money from the same, previously existing content?<ref>{{cite web | last1=Draper Carlson | first1=Johanna |first2=K.C. | last2=Carlson | url=http://comicsworthreading.com/2009/08/23/whats-the-point-of-a-motion-comic/ | title=What's the Point of a Motion Comic | publisher = ComicsWorthReading.com | accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref>}}
Artist [[John Cassaday]] described his experience with the motion comic adaptation of ''[[Astonishing X-Men]]'', saying: {{quote|I'd seen some motion comic animation, and the quality varied. When Marvel approached me, I was initially hesitant, but after looking at some test footage and hearing how committed they were, I knew what direction they were wanting to go."<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=23421 | title=Cassaday on the "Astonishing X-Men" Motion Comic | publisher= [[ComicBookResources.com]] | first=Dave | last=Richards | date=October 23, 2009 | accessdate=April 6, 2010}}</ref>}}
==Comparison to visual novels== The [[visual novel]], a form of [[interactive fiction]] largely created in [[Japan]] (and also constituting the majority of [[PC game]]s sold in the country), makes similar usage of animated transitions between still graphic images for narrative purposes. Visual novels, which have been released since the 1980s, also make use of background music and voice talents in order to help drive the narrative.
However, unlike most Western motion comics: * Visual novels only occasionally make use of motion in-scene (i.e., a body part moving inside an otherwise-static scene). * Visual novels, while making use of voice talents, also provide dialogue through dialogue boxes - usually superimposed on the bottom of the screen. * Visual novel characters are usually depicted through graphic [[sprite (computer graphics)|sprites]] superimposed upon a generic background; more detailed character designs and backgrounds are typically reserved for key scenes and events in the narrative. * The majority of visual novels are original properties and are adapted for, rather than adaptations of, manga or anime. * Visual novels can either be little more than [[interactive film]]s or much more interactive [[adventure game]]s, with the dialog boxes containing controls for interaction with the game. * Visual novels are also typically written from the [[first-person narrative]]. * Most visual novels have [[Dialogue tree|dialogue choices]], [[Nonlinear gameplay|branching storylines]], and [[multiple endings]]. ==List of Motion Comics Projects==
*''[[Watchmen: Motion Comic]]'' (2008) *''[[Astonishing X-Men]]'' (2009) *''[[Batgirl: Year One]]'' (2009) *''[[Superman:_Red_Son#Miscelleanous|Superman: Red Son]]'' (2009) *''[[Spider-Woman (2009 series)|Spider-Woman]]'' (2009) *''[[Jonah_Hex#Motion_comics|Jonah Hex]]'' (2010) *''[[Black Panther (TV series)|Black Panther]]'' (2010)
==References== {{reflist|2}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox magazine | logo = [[File:Newly_Swissed_Logo.png|200px]] | logo_size = | image_file = | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = | editor = Dimitri Burkhard | editor_title = | previous_editor = | staff_writer = | photographer = | category = | frequency = | circulation = | publisher = | founder = | founded = 2010 | firstdate= January 2010 | company = | country = Switerzland | based = | language = English | website = {{URL|www.newlyswissed.com}} | issn = | oclc = }} '''''Newly Swissed''''' is a digital entertainment magazine about [[Switzerland]], first published in January 2010. It covers topics related to culture, design, events, oddities and tourism in Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ronorp.net/zurich_en/ron-orps-mail/archive/newsletter/b95302860c594dd777456af6a51dce10|title=Web tip: New in town| work=Ron Orp|date=5 February 2015|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://swisscgny.tumblr.com/page/26|title=Swiss Event In NYC Jul 8-23| work=Swiss GNY|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref>
==History== ''Newly Swissed'' was launched in 2010 by Dimitri Burkhard, a digital marketing expert.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.helloswitzerland.ch/-/from-buckeyes-to-newly-swissed| title=From Buckeyes To Newly Swissed|work=Hello Switzerland|date=27 October 2015|accessdate=18 December 2016|author=Ashley Roque}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.globesession.com/edition07/artikel/top-10-beste-schweizer-reiseblogs/|title=Top10 – Beste Schweizer Reiseblogs|work=globesession|accessdate=18 December 2016|author=Martin Hoch}}</ref> The magazine incorporated as Newly Swissed GmbH in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.moneyhouse.ch/de/company/newly-swissed-gmbh-6760123481|title=Newly Swissed GmbH|work=Moneyhouse|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.themenpuls.ch/2015/02/04/blogcharts-januar-expats-bewegen-die-schweiz/|title=Blogcharts November: Der Datenblog des Tages-Anzeigers ist der Aufsteiger|work=Blog von Themenpuls|date=4 February 2015| accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref> At the time, it was the only online magazine about Switzerland written in English. ''Newly Swissed'' is frequently quoted by major publications on the subject of expat life in Switzerland.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/expat/2015/05/06/why-switzerland-so-often-tops-quality-of-life-surveys/ |title=Why Switzerland So Often Tops Quality-of-Life Surveys|author=Chantal Panozzo|date=6 May 2015|work=The Wall Street Journal|access-date=18 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.annabelle.ch/leben/gesellschaft/allein-unter-fremden-expats-schweiz-43990|title=Allein unter Fremden: Expats in der Schweiz|last=Dinah Leuenberger|work=Annabelle|access-date=18 December 2016}}</ref>
In the early stages, observations about Swiss lifestyle and culture served as the main sources of content. Now, the magazine covers a range of topics in depth, from architecture to oddities, and from tourism to advice on in Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dicconbewes.com/2012/07/20/have-you-been-newly-swissed-yet/|title=Have you been Newly Swissed yet?|work=Diccon Bewes|date=July 2012|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref> The publication is primarily concerned with serving the international community in Switzerland, as well as the Swiss population living abroad.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://zurich1200fountains.wordpress.com/2013/04/22/zurich-1200-fountains-in-newly-swissed/| title=Zurich 1200 Fountains in Newly Swissed|work=Zurich1200Funtains|date=22 April 2015|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref> Much of the magazine’s success has historically been built on its journalistic coverage of Switzerland from the perspective of multiple writers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newlyswissed.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Blick-am-Abend_031214_page252.pdf|title=Follow me |work=Blick am Abend}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newlyswissed.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/regio-Newly-Swissed-Feb-5-2015_singlepage.pdf |title=Ein Blog für Zugezogene |publisher=züriost}}</ref>
The readership is primarily located in Switzerland, followed by the [[United States]] and the [[United Kingdom]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newlyswissed.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/NaG-Newly-Swissed-March-2013.pdf|title=Online-Magazin beschreibt die Eigenarten der Schweiz|work=Greifensee}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.newlyswissed.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/08/Swiss-Review-Aug2013-short.pdf|title=Swissmakers online|work=Swiss Review}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.newlyswissed.com/ ''Newly Swissed'' website]

Lama | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer =James Pradhan | country = [[Nepal]] | language =Nepali, English, Hindi | num_seasons =1 | num_episodes =7 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = Kavita Srinivasan | producer =Musumusu Productions | location = Nepal | cinematography =Rupesh Thapa | editor =Shankar Koirala, Animesh Sapkota, Pawan R. Joshi | camera = | runtime = 20 mins | company = | distributor = | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = {{start date|2016|04|25|df=yes}} | last_aired = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related =https://www.youtube.com/c/Musumusutv | website =http://musumusu.tv/ | network = Musumusu TV }} '''''P.S. Zindagi''''' (Post Seismic Life) is Nepal's first online [[sitcom]]. It shows the unfolding of comedy and drama in the lives of five Nepali youth from diverse backgrounds, following the [[April 2015 Nepal earthquake]]. It was a creative experiment where a small team used their own individual resources and passion to create a fun and self-empowering narrative of the lives of the urban youth.{{cite web |url=http://neostuffs.com/2016/05/p-s-zindagi-the-web-series-you-should-be-watching-right-now/|title=P.S zindagi , the web series you should be watching right now |publisher=neostuffs.com}}{{cite news|url=http://english.onlinekhabar.com/2016/07/21/382153|title=‘P.S. Zindagi’ Season I review: For the first time|publisher=english.onlinekhabar.com}}{{cite news |url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2016-05-15/ps-zindagi-reconfiguring-nepali-entertainment.html|title=PS Zindagi reconfiguring Nepali entertainment|publisher=kathmandupost.ekantipur.com}}{{cite news |url=http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2016-06-19/ps-zindagi-for-a-better-world.html|title=PS Zindagi: For a Better World|publisher=kathmandupost.ekantipur.com}} ==Cast== * Rajkumar Pudasaini * Sujata Koirala * Utpal Jha * Kavita Srinivasan * Kalsang D. Lama * Menuka Pradhan (Cameo) ==Awards== ''P.S. Zindagi'' has won the Outstanding Excellence award for Direction and Ensemble Cast in the WRPN.TV Global Webisode Competition (WGWC), in Summer 2016. This is UK-based global competition for webisodes and TV series from 41 countries. This competition aims to promote and present a worldwide community of Webisodes/TV series.{{cite web |url=http://neostuffs.com/2016/08/nepali-sitcom-p-s-zindagi-wins-major-award-global-contest/|title=Nepali sitcom P.S zindagi wins major award global contest|publisher=neostuffs.com}}{{cite news |url=https://thehimalayantimes.com/entertainment/ps-zindagi-wrpn-tv-global-webisode-competition-wgwc/|title=PS Zindagi strikes a chord|publisher=thehimalayantimes.com}}http://wgwc1.com/Pages/WGWC_Summer2016_Winners.html ''P.S. Zindagi'' has also been officially selected to compete in the Marseille Web Fest (October 2016), the DMOFF Festival (August 2016) and the Indiewise Festival (September 2016). ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/c/Musumusutv Musumusu on Youtube] * [http://musumusu.tv/ Musumus.tv] [[Category:2016 web series debuts]] [[Category:Nepalese web series]] {{Nepal-stub}}

'''[[Performing arts]] presenting organizations''' facilitate exchanges between artists and audiences through creative, educational, and performance opportunities. The work that these artists perform is produced outside of the presenting organization.<ref>[http://www.urban.org/url.cfm?ID=410604 "The Capacity of Performing Arts Presenting Organizations,"] by Mark A. Hager and Thomas H. Pollak, The [[Urban Institute]], Center on Nonprofits and Philanthropy, April 2002.</ref>
Performing arts presenters are typically found in three varieties: *Those attached to a college, university, or other educational institution, with performances usually taking place on campus; *Those that are an administrative branch of a theater or concert hall, usually presenting performances only in that space; *Those that are independently administered outside any specific venue, usually renting multiple venues for performances.
The [[Association of Performing Arts Presenters]], located in Washington, D.C., is the largest organizing body of performing arts presenters in the United States. The primary international organizing body of performing arts presenters is the International Society for the Performing Arts.[http://www.ispa.org/]
==Performing arts presenters in the United States== * [[Celebrity Series of Boston]] ([[Boston, Massachusetts]]) * [[Rockport Music]] ([[Rockport, Massachusetts]]) * [[University Musical Society]] ([[Ann Arbor, Michigan]]) * [[Whitefish Theatre Company]] ([[Whitefish, Montana]]) * [[Hopkins Center for the Arts]] ([[Dartmouth College]], [[Hanover, New Hampshire]]) * [[The Music Hall (Portsmouth)|The Music Hall]], ([[Portsmouth, New Hampshire]])
==References== {{refimprove|date=February 2012}} {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Performing Arts Presenters}} [[Category:Performing arts]] [[Category:Performing arts education]]

revision.text:
{{mi| {{Orphan|date=October 2011}} {{no footnotes|date=May 2018}} {{notability|date=May 2018}} {{unreliable sources|date=May 2018}} }} '''Polaqia''' (frequently misspelled Polaquia) is a group of comic-book creators born in [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] (a state in the northwest of [[Spain]]) who self-publish their own projects besides working for external publishers. Currently it's a legally constituted cultural association. ==History== Founded in June 2001 by writer Kike Benlloch and artists Bernal, Jano, David Rubín and Alberto Vázquez, its editorial debut took place in August of the same year with the 48 page anthology "Mmmh!!", a collection of speechless B/W short stories. In 2002, two individual [[comic-books]] were published, the intimist "Patricia" by Jano and the ironic "Alter ego" by Alberto Vázquez. Both artists left Polaqia soon. In 2003 Polaqia launched its twice-a-year anthology "Barsowia". "Barsowia" has reached issue number fourteen by August 2009. Only two founding members are still in the organisation, Bernal and David Rubín, after Kike Benlloch's departure in 2009. Other artists featured under the seal are Emma Ríos with her 4 issue [sci-fi] miniseries "A prueba de balas" and Álvaro López with three one-shots ("Feliz cumpleaños, May", "A voz na caixa" and "38", the latter co-created with Luís Sendón). Self-published books from Polaqia also include "Corazón de tormentas" by David Rubín and "Tanque Familiar" by Diego Blanco. ==Awards== Barsowia won in June 2006 the Readers' Award for Best Fanzine in [[Spain]], 2005, at the Barcelona Convention, Spain's main comic-related event. At the same festival Barsowia won in April 2007 the Official Award for Best Fanzine in [[Spain]], 2006. This award is voted by professionals and critics alike and the highest honor a fanzine can achieve in Spain. The third award to the group was given by the Youth House of Ourense: The Premio Ourense de BD is the main regional award, it acknowledges annually the best comic-related work in Galicia. ==Current lines of work== Besides the ongoing Barsowia and self-conclusive comic-books, Polaqia publishes a series of mini art-books ("Polaqia Sketchbook", #1 by Miguel Robledo) and a collection of graphic novels in Spanish ("Rompehielos", the first title is 76-page "Pinche Mundo" by Kike Benlloch and Diego Blanco). ==Languages== Polaqia has published books both in [[Spanish language|Spanish]] and [[Galician language]], as well as short stories in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]. ==Members== As of December 2009 the current Polaqia members (11) are Hugo Covelo, Roque Romero, Brais Rodríguez, Diego Blanco, David Rubín, Sergio Covelo, Bernal Prieto, Álvaro López, Emma Ríos, Luís Sendón, Jose Domingo. Meanwhile, the anthology "Barsowia" has had uncountable contributors including Michael Bonfiglio (USA), Bouss (France), Louis Bertrand Devaud (France), Ken Niimura (Spain), Esteban Hernández (Spain), Susa Monteiro (Portugal), Paulo Monteiro (Portugal). ==Coordinators== Kike Benlloch 2001-2006
Hugo Covelo 2006-2008
David Rubín 2008-2009 ==References== * [http://www.polaqia.com Polaqia] * [http://www.redegalega.org/kikebenlloch/comics/pinchemundo/index.htm Pinche Mundo] * [http://www.redegalega.org/polaqia/anuncio-orig-baixa.jpg Graphic novels by Polaqia members for external publishers] * [http://picasaweb.google.com/polaqia Polaqia photo galleries] * [http://www.redegalega.org/polaqia/blogs.htm Polaqia members' personal web sites] [[Category:Organizations established in 2001]] [[Category:Comics-related organizations]] [[Category:Spanish comics]]

{{Infobox company | name= Rakuten TV | logo= Rakuten TV 2017 logo.png | logo_size= | type=[[Subsidiary]] | industry=[[Electronic commerce]] | genre= | foundation=2010 | founder=Jacinto Roca, Josep Mitjà | dissolved= | location_city = [[Barcelona]] | area_served= {{unbulleted list|[[Austria]]|[[France]]|[[Germany]]|[[Ireland]]|[[Italy]]|[[Spain]]|[[UK]]|[[Portugal]]|[[Switzerland]]|[[Belgium]]|[[Netherlands]]}} | key_people=Jacinto Roca [[Chief Executive Officer|(CEO)]]
Josep Mitjà [[Chief Operating Officer|(COO)]]
Miquel Barba [[Chief Technology Officer|(CTO)]] | products=[[Video on demand]] films and tv series | revenue= | operating_income= | net_income= | num_employees=200 | parent=[[Rakuten]] | footnotes= | location_country = Spain | homepage= https://www.rakuten.tv/ }} '''Rakuten TV''' is a [[Video on demand|video-on-demand (VOD)]] streaming service, offering movies and TV series for subscription, rental and purchase. Rakuten TV’s catalogue includes content from the biggest studios around the world including Warner Bros., Disney, Sony Pictures Entertainment and Twentieth Century Fox Home Entertainment, local distributors, and independent labels, being the smallest and least known service among its competitors. Rakuten TV’s content can be streamed to most devices, offering a similar service as netflix and other streaming services,.{{Cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/uk/2014/05/28/wuaki-tv-now-available-stream-chromecast-uk/|title=Wuaki.Tv Is Now Available to Stream on Chromecast in the UK|last=Woods|first=Ben|website=The Next Web|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-19}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.pocket-lint.com/news/123395-wuaki-tv-streaming-service-now-available-on-xbox-360-2-99-a-month-for-life-offer-still-on|title=Wuaki.tv streaming service now available on Xbox 360, £2.99 a month for life offer still on - Pocket-lint|website=www.pocket-lint.com|access-date=2016-04-19}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2013/08/09/wuaki-tv-video-service-gets-android-ipad-app-support-in-uk/|title=Wuaki.tv video service gets Android, iPad app support in UK|website=Engadget|access-date=2016-04-19}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.digitaltveurope.net/237461/wuaki-launches-new-4k-smart-tv-app/|title=Wuaki launches new 4K smart TV app » Digital TV Europe|website=www.digitaltveurope.net|access-date=2016-04-19}} The company is headquartered in [[Barcelona]] and currently operates in eleven countries around Europe; Spain, UK, France, Germany, Italy, Austria, Ireland, Belgium, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Portugal and Switzerland. In June 2012 – [[Rakuten]], the world’s third largest e-commerce company, acquired the company previously known as Wuaki.tv.{{Cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/insider/2012/06/13/japanese-e-commerce-giant-rakuten-buys-spanish-video-on-demand-firm-wuaki-tv/|title=Rakuten Acquires Spanish Video-On-Demand Company Wuaki.tv|last=Wauters|first=Robin|website=The Next Web|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-19}} In July 2017 – Wuaki.tv changed its name to Rakuten TV. In May 2018 - Rakuten took over the user base from [[TalkTalk TV Store]] (previously Blinkbox) including migration of user purchased titles. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Rakuten}} {{Video digital distribution platforms}} [[Category:Video on demand services]] [[Category:Video rental services]] [[Category:Rakuten]] [[Category:Companies based in Barcelona]] [[Category:2010 establishments in Spain]] {{Spain-company-stub}}
